info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:03PM EDT until June 14 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR ATKINSON COUNTY... At 701 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles southwest of Pearson, moving east at 15 mph. Based on radar it appears a new, second tornado may have formed in the southern part of the county and the northern funnel may be weakening. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Pearson around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Axson. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
